datastructs
Class ElevatorImpl

java.lang.Object
  datastructs.ElevatorImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Elevator
public class ElevatorImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Elevator

This class is used to implement the interface Elevator. An elevator has a maximum capacity of people it can take at a time. It has a set of people currently inside the lift. It stores the direction in which the lift is going currently It has a flag stating whether it is operational or not It has a set of buttons pressed inside the lift.

Author:
vijay

Constructor for ElevatorImpl class

Parameters:
peopleInLift - people currently in lift
currentFloor - the floor at which the elevator is in
currentDirection - the direction in which the elevator is going
isOperational - boolean flag stating whether the elevator is operational
buttonsPressed - a sorted set of all buttons pressed in the elevator

ElevatorImpl

public ElevatorImpl()
Constructor for ElevatorImpl class Creates a new set for people currently in lift and the buttons pressed in lift. Initializes current floor to 0 Sets the flag that the elevator is operational.
